channel.title: BBC News - Europe
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Afghanistan crisis: Chaos as Europeans scramble to evacuate Kabul
item.description: Several countries rush to fly people out, as the Dutch government is criticised for reacting slowly.

item.title: Lithuania says Belarus officers illegally pushed migrants over border
item.description: Video shows 12 Belarusian officers in riot gear as migrants scramble towards Lithuanian territory.

item.title: I don't believe Taliban pledge on women's rights, Priti Patel says
item.description: The bulk of Afghans resettled in the UK will be persecuted minorities, the home secretary says.

item.title: Teenage pilot Zara Rutherford begins solo round-world record bid
item.description: Zara Rutherford completes the first leg of her journey from Belgium to England.

item.title: France wildfire: Thousands evacuated as blaze rages near Riviera
item.description: Firefighters clear campsites in the Var region as some 5,000 hectares are destroyed by fire.

item.title: BBC presenter flees French fires
item.description: "It was very, very, very frightening," says Geeta Guru-Murthy.

item.title: Bayern Munich beat Borussia Dortmund to retain German Super Cup title
item.description: Bayern Munich striker Robert Lewandowski scores twice to help his side retain the German Super Cup with a 3-1 win over Borussia Dortmund.

item.title: Peter Karlsson: The painful verdict on Swedish ice hockey player's 1995 killing
item.description: Peter Karlsson was stabbed to death in the street. His killer said he was protecting himself - via the so-called 'gay panic' defence.

item.title: 'My night in Quisling's cabin'
item.description: When Ben McPherson realised he could rent Vidkun Quisling's cabin, it struck him as weird. His Norwegian wife disagreed.

item.title: Climate change: Does Germany produce double the UK's carbon emissions?
item.description: MP John Redwood claims that, on carbon emissions, Germany "puts out twice as much as we do". Is he right?

item.title: No Messi, no Ramos - how is La Liga shaping up?
item.description: No Lionel Messi, no Sergio Ramos, no Zinedine Zidane - how are Spain's 'big three' looking - or could there be a new title winner?

item.title: Kiwi Chow: The film-maker who took Hong Kong's protests to Cannes
item.description: Kiwi Chow's documentary was a surprise at the film festival - and it has a controversial title.

item.title: Bardsey: Lure of the island with no electricity or wi-fi
item.description: There is no hot water or showers on the island, and it is thought that is why people are attracted.

item.title: Afghan reporter asks Nato secretary general for help
item.description: Lailuma Sadid, a journalist with Brussels Morning Newspaper, became emotional when asking the Nato secretary general about the Taliban in Afghanistan.

item.title: The shopkeeper saving his island from wildfires
item.description: Spyros isn't a firefighter, but when his home was threatened with wildfires, he decided to take action.

item.title: Greece fires: Hundreds rescued by coastguard
item.description: The coastguard moved 650 people from Limni, in the north of the island of Evia.

item.title: Lukashenko: 'You can choke on your sanctions in the UK'
item.description: The UK and US are tightening sanctions on Belarus, hitting economic sectors.

item.title: 'They call me the Irish hulk of basketball'
item.description: Aidan Igiehon is part of a group of elite Irish athletes playing college basketball in America.
